title: Scarlett Moffatt looks partied out leaving Attitude Awards with new body confidence
text:

Scarlett Moffatt flaunted her new-found confidence on Wednesday evening as she left London's Roundhouse venue after attending the Virgin Atlantic Attitude Awards.

The reality TV star, 29, wowed in a dramatic black dress with a glamorous train just days after proudly admitting that she is 'finally body confident'.

The former Gogglebox personality appeared slightly bleary-eyed as she made her departure alongside her mum Betty and fellow event attendees X Factor's Ella Henderson , singing sensation Sophie Ellis-Bextor and classical performer Camilla Kerslake.

(Image: CURLEY)

Scarlett seemed to have let her hair down at the event as she showed off her gleaming pearly whites and flashed an uncontrollable smile to onlooking photographers.

Earlier in the evening, Scarlett turned heads on the red carpet with her mum Betty, who appeared to have a stunning makeover and debuted a fiery red dress.

The star's confident display comes as she opened up to New! magazine about her figure .

(Image: CURLEY)

(Image: CURLEY)

Scarlett, who has been targeted for her changing shape over the years, has discussed how she is now "really happy" and "embracing her body."

In an aim to shut down trolls who want to slam her appearance, the bubbly star revealed she was planning to show-off her figure instead of covering up.

"The world would be a boring place if we all looked the same," she told the magazine.

(Image: Nils Jorgensen/REX)

Scarlett continued: "I've been lots of different shapes and sizes but I feel like now I'm just really happy in myself and I think that reflects on the outside.

"I'm not pretending that I'm the perfect body shape. I've got boobs and hips and rather than try and cover them up, I'm embracing them. I'm trying to show them off a bit more."

Scarlett has always been open about the fact that she has been bombarded with sickening abuse since her TV debut from anonymous online haters .

(Image: WireImage)

The star rose to the spotlight on Channel 4's Gogglebox alongside her family and went on to star in popular TV shows I’m A Celebrity , Saturday Night Takeaway and Streetmate.

Earlier this year, Scarlett confessed she was left house-bound as a result of online trolling.

The TV star recoiled in horror when she was called "fat" and mocked by viewers for revealing a hint of her bra in a plunging dress on Love Island's After Sun.

(Image: PA)

But Scarlett has pledged to champion body confidence in the face of trolls.

Just last week, she admitted that she sometimes reaches out to trolls on social media to see if they’re okay as she believes "hurt people, hurt people".

The former Gogglebox star has recently launched her very first fashion range with High Street favourite Peacocks.

The affordable Scarlett Loves Peacock edit caters for women from size 8 to size 22, with prices for fashion items starting from £6.00.
description: The Gogglebox star couldn't hold back her giggles as she left the star-studded bash just days after announcing her new-found body confidence
